message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SD, cs.NA, cs.SY, cs.LG

Reasoning: The paper deals with pulse design in multicarrier transmission, which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT). It also involves the adaptation of pulse shapes to the second order statistics of the channel, which is related to signal processing (cs.SD). The use of unitary representations of the Weyl-Heisenberg group suggests a connection to mathematical analysis and numerical algorithms (cs.NA). The reformulation of the problem as a differential equation and the identification of optimal pulses as eigenstates of the harmonic oscillator Hamiltonian suggest a connection to control theory and systems theory (cs.SY). Finally, the use of operator-algebraic methods to provide exact solutions for different classes of scattering environments suggests a connection to machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG).
